interactor.description: An interactor object represents an interacting molecule.

id.description: Unique identifier for this interactor. In most of the cases, it is generated from the interactor main database accession

identifier.description: The preferred identifier for this interactor. It is usually a primary database accession (uniprotkb for proteins, ensembl for genes, chebi for small molecules, refseq for nucleic acids, etc.)

db.description: The database name. Most of the time, the name will match a term from the PSI-MI ontology http://www.ebi.ac.uk/ontology-lookup/browse.do?ontName=MI&termId=MI%3A0444&termName=database%20citation. It represents the unique PSI shortlabel for this database

id.description: The database identifier/accession. It usually represents the primary accession of this object in a specific database.

uri.description: Uniform Resource Identifier for this interactor.

label.description: The short name of the interactor which is usually used for visualizing an interactor in a network

object.description: The object for an interactor is always 'interactor'. It helps to distinguish interactors from interactions in the data array

common.description: The common name or short name of the organism.

scientific.description: The scientific name of full name of the organism.

taxid.description: The uniprot taxonomy identifier for this organism. Can be -1 if in vitro, -2 if chemical synthesis, -3 if unknown, -4 if in vivo

sequence.description: The sequence of nucleic acids/amino acids of this interactor if it is a nucleic acid/protein

type.description: The interactor type. It is usually a term from the PSI-MI ontology: http://www.ebi.ac.uk/ontology-lookup/browse.do?ontName=MI&termId=MI%3A0313&termName=interactor%20type

id.description: The interactor type MI identifier from the PSI-MI ontology: http://www.ebi.ac.uk/ontology-lookup/browse.do?ontName=MI&termId=MI%3A0313&termName=interactor%20type

name.description: The interactor type unique short name from the PSI-MI ontology: http://www.ebi.ac.uk/ontology-lookup/browse.do?ontName=MI&termId=MI%3A0313&termName=interactor%20type

setComponents.description: If the interactor is a set of interactors (we don't know which one interacts but one of them does interact) or a complex, we can describe all the interactors which are member of this set or complex.

interaction.description: An interaction object represents an interaction between one to many interactor instances (participants). It can be an interaction evidence (experiment is provided and is not inferred by curator) or a biological complex which can be then re-used as an interactor in another interaction (no experiment provided or experiment provided with inferred by curator).

experiment.description: Experiment where this interaction has been detected. If the interaction detection method is inferred by curator, the interaction is probably a biological complex and not a real interaction evidence.

detmethod.description: Interaction detection method. It is usually a term of the PSI-MI ontology: http://www.ebi.ac.uk/ontology-lookup/browse.do?ontName=MI&termId=MI%3A0001&termName=interaction%20detection%20method

id.description: The interaction detection method MI identifier from the PSI-MI ontology: http://www.ebi.ac.uk/ontology-lookup/browse.do?ontName=MI&termId=MI%3A0001&termName=interaction%20detection%20method

name.description: The interaction detection method unique short name from the PSI-MI ontology: http://www.ebi.ac.uk/ontology-lookup/browse.do?ontName=MI&termId=MI%3A0001&termName=interaction%20detection%20method

experimentModifications.description: A list of experimental modifications done in a specific experiment.

items.description: The description of the experimental modification done in a specific experiment. It is a free text comment.
The figure legend which illustrate this experiment in a scientific publication. It is a free text comment.

host.description: The host organism where the interaction has been detected.

common.description: The common name or short name of the organism.

scientific.description: The scientific name of full name of the organism.

taxid.description: The uniprot taxonomy identifier for this organism. Can be -1 if in vitro, -2 if chemical synthesis, -3 if unknown, -4 if in vivo

cellType.description: The cell type of the host organism.

id.description: The cell type ontology identifier if one exists.

name.description: The cell type short name.

tissue.description: The source tissue of the host organism.

id.description: The source tissue ontology identifier if one exists.

name.description: The source tissue short name.

compartment.description: The subcellular compartment of the host organism.

id.description: The subcellular compartment ontology identifier if one exists.

name.description: The subcellular compartment type short name.

pubid.description: The list of publication identifiers where this experiment has been reported (pubmed, doi, imex, etc.).

db.description: The database name (usually pubmed, doi or imex). Most of the time, the name will match a term from the PSI-MI ontology http://www.ebi.ac.uk/ontology-lookup/browse.do?ontName=MI&termId=MI%3A0444&termName=database%20citation. It represents the unique PSI shortlabel for this database

id.description: The database identifier/accession. It usually represents the primary accession of this object in a specific database.

uri.description: Uniform Resource Identifier for the publication.

sourceDatabase.description: The institution/organisation which have curated and provided these experimental details. Most of the time, it is aterm of the PSI-MI ontology: http://www.ebi.ac.uk/ontology-lookup/browse.do?ontName=MI&termId=MI%3A0461&termName=interaction%20database

id.description: The institution MI identifier if it exists form the PSI-MI ontology http://www.ebi.ac.uk/ontology-lookup/browse.do?ontName=MI&termId=MI%3A0461&termName=interaction%20database.

name.description: The institution name. Most of the time, the name will match a term from the PSI-MI ontology http://www.ebi.ac.uk/ontology-lookup/browse.do?ontName=MI&termId=MI%3A0461&termName=interaction%20database. It represents the unique PSI shortlabel for this database

id.description: Unique identifier for this interaction. For biological complexes, it is generated from the complex main database accession and for interaction evidences, it usually is the IMEx identifier or a automatically generated id

identifiers.description: An list of database identifiers for this interaction.

items.description: A database identifier for this interaction. It usually can be used to link to interaction resources for more details.

db.description: The database name. Most of the time, the name will match a term from the PSI-MI ontology http://www.ebi.ac.uk/ontology-lookup/browse.do?ontName=MI&termId=MI%3A0444&termName=database%20citation. It represents the unique PSI shortlabel for this database

id.description: The database identifier/accession. It usually represents the primary accession of this object in a specific database.

uri.description: Uniform Resource Identifier for this interaction.

interactionType.description: The interaction type which is usually term from PSI-MI ontology: http://www.ebi.ac.uk/ontology-lookup/browse.do?ontName=MI&termId=MI%3A0190&termName=interaction%20type.

id.description: The interaction type MI identifier from the PSI-MI ontology: http://www.ebi.ac.uk/ontology-lookup/browse.do?ontName=MI&termId=MI%3A0190&termName=interaction%20type.

name.description: The interaction type unique short name from the PSI-MI ontology: http://www.ebi.ac.uk/ontology-lookup/browse.do?ontName=MI&termId=MI%3A0190&termName=interaction%20type.

object.description: The object for an interaction or biological complex is always 'interaction'. It helps to distinguish interactors from interactions in the data array

participants.description: The list of participants/interactor instances which are involved in this interaction.

items.description: Participant involved in this interaction. It represents an instance of the interactor/molecule within this interaction

id.description: Unique identifier for this participant/interactor instance.

interactorRef.description: Interactor id reference for this participant. It points to the id of an interactor described in this data array.

bioRole.description: Participant biological role which is usually a term from the PSI-MI ontology: http://www.ebi.ac.uk/ontology-lookup/browse.do?ontName=MI&termId=MI%3A0500&termName=biological%20role

id.description: The biological role MI identifier from the PSI-MI ontology: http://www.ebi.ac.uk/ontology-lookup/browse.do?ontName=MI&termId=MI%3A0500&termName=biological%20role.

name.description: The biological role unique short name from the PSI-MI ontology: http://www.ebi.ac.uk/ontology-lookup/browse.do?ontName=MI&termId=MI%3A0500&termName=biological%20role.

expRole.description: Participant experimental role (only for interaction evidences, not biological complexes) which is usually a term from the PSI-MI ontology: http://www.ebi.ac.uk/ontology-lookup/browse.do?ontName=MI&termId=MI%3A0495&termName=experimental%20role

id.description: The experimental role MI identifier from the PSI-MI ontology: http://www.ebi.ac.uk/ontology-lookup/browse.do?ontName=MI&termId=MI%3A0495&termName=experimental%20role.

name.description: The experimental role unique short name from the PSI-MI ontology: http://www.ebi.ac.uk/ontology-lookup/browse.do?ontName=MI&termId=MI%3A0495&termName=experimental%20role.

experimentalPrep.description: List of experimental preparations if the participant is from an interaction evidence, not a biological complex. It is usually a term from PSI-MI ontology: http://www.ebi.ac.uk/ontology-lookup/browse.do?ontName=MI&termId=MI%3A0346&termName=experimental%20prep.

items.description: Participant identification method (only for interaction evidences, not biological complexes) which is usually a term from the PSI-MI ontology: http://www.ebi.ac.uk/ontology-lookup/browse.do?ontName=MI&termId=MI%3A0346&termName=experimental%20prep

id.description: The participant identification method MI identifier from the PSI-MI ontology:http://www.ebi.ac.uk/ontology-lookup/browse.do?ontName=MI&termId=MI%3A0346&termName=experimental%20prep.

name.description: The participant identification method unique short name from the PSI-MI ontology: http://www.ebi.ac.uk/ontology-lookup/browse.do?ontName=MI&termId=MI%3A0002&termName=experimental%20prep.

identificationMethods.description: List of participant identification methods if the participant is from an interaction evidence, not a biological complex. It is usually a term from PSI-MI ontology: http://www.ebi.ac.uk/ontology-lookup/browse.do?ontName=MI&termId=MI%3A0002&termName=participant%20identification%20method

items.description: Participant identification method (only for interaction evidences, not biological complexes) which is usually a term from the PSI-MI ontology: http://www.ebi.ac.uk/ontology-lookup/browse.do?ontName=MI&termId=MI%3A0002&termName=participant%20identification%20method

id.description: The participant identification method MI identifier from the PSI-MI ontology: http://www.ebi.ac.uk/ontology-lookup/browse.do?ontName=MI&termId=MI%3A0002&termName=participant%20identification%20method.

name.description: The participant identification method unique short name from the PSI-MI ontology: http://www.ebi.ac.uk/ontology-lookup/browse.do?ontName=MI&termId=MI%3A0002&termName=participant%20identification%20method.

expressedIn.description: The host organism where the participant has been expressed in. It is only valid for interaction evidences and does not make sense for biological complexes.

common.description: The common name or short name of the organism.

scientific.description: The scientific name of full name of the organism.

taxid.description: The uniprot taxonomy identifier for this organism. Can be -1 if in vitro, -2 if chemical synthesis, -3 if unknown, -4 if in vivo

cellType.description: The cell type of the host organism.

id.description: The cell type ontology identifier if one exists.

name.description: The cell type short name.

tissue.description: The source tissue of the host organism.

id.description: The source tissue ontology identifier if one exists.

name.description: The source tissue short name.

compartment.description: The subcellular compartment of the host organism.

id.description: The subcellular compartment ontology identifier if one exists.

name.description: The subcellular compartment type short name.

confidences.description: List of experimental confidences for this participant. It does not make sense for biological complexes.

items.description: The experimental confidence determined fro this participant.

type.description: Confidence type which is usually a term from the PSI-MI ontology: http://www.ebi.ac.uk/ontology-lookup/browse.do?ontName=MI&termId=MI%3A1064&termName=confidence

id.description: The confidence type MI identifier from the PSI-MI ontology: http://www.ebi.ac.uk/ontology-lookup/browse.do?ontName=MI&termId=MI%3A1064&termName=confidence.

name.description: The confidence type unique short name from the PSI-MI ontology: http://www.ebi.ac.uk/ontology-lookup/browse.do?ontName=MI&termId=MI%3A1064&termName=confidence.

value.description: Confidence value which is free text as it can be quantitative as qualitative.

parameters.description: List of experimental parameters for this participant. It does not make sense for biological complexes.

items.description: The experimental parameter determined fro this participant.

type.description: Parameter type which is usually a term from the PSI-MI ontology: http://www.ebi.ac.uk/ontology-lookup/browse.do?ontName=MI&termId=MI%3A0640&termName=parameter%20type

id.description: The parameter type MI identifier from the PSI-MI ontology: http://www.ebi.ac.uk/ontology-lookup/browse.do?ontName=MI&termId=MI%3A0640&termName=parameter%20type.

name.description: The parameter type unique short name from the PSI-MI ontology: http://www.ebi.ac.uk/ontology-lookup/browse.do?ontName=MI&termId=MI%3A0640&termName=parameter%20type.

unit.description: Parameter unit which is usually a term from the PSI-MI ontology: http://www.ebi.ac.uk/ontology-lookup/browse.do?ontName=MI&termId=MI%3A0647&termName=parameter%20unit

id.description: The parameter unit MI identifier from the PSI-MI ontology: http://www.ebi.ac.uk/ontology-lookup/browse.do?ontName=MI&termId=MI%3A0647&termName=parameter%20unit.

name.description: The parameter unit unique short name from the PSI-MI ontology: http://www.ebi.ac.uk/ontology-lookup/browse.do?ontName=MI&termId=MI%3A0647&termName=parameter%20unit.

features.description: List of features attached to this participant.

items.description: The experimental feature attached to this participant (tag, etc.). See the PSI-MI ontology for all types of experimental features: http://www.ebi.ac.uk/ontology-lookup/browse.do?ontName=MI&termId=MI%3A0505&termName=experimental%20feature

id.description: Unique identifier for this feature instance.

name.description: The feature short name.

category.description: The category of feature: experimentalFeature if only experimental data (not relevant for complexes), ptms, pointMutations, bindingSites, otherFeatures if no categories can be found because the feature types are not from PSI-MI ontology...

sequenceData.description: The list of feature sequence ranges.

participantRef.description: The id of the interactor instance/participant this feature belongs to..

interactorRef.description: The id of the interactor/molecule this feature is referring to.

pos.description: The sequence positions. If the sequence positions are unknown, they are encoded with ?-?. If the positions are n-terminal range, they are encoded with n-n. If the positions are C terminal range, they are encoded with c-c. If the positions are fuzzy, they are encoded with x1..x2-x3..x4.

detMethods.description: List of feature detection methods if the feature is from an interaction evidence, not a biological complex. It is usually a term from PSI-MI ontology: http://www.ebi.ac.uk/ontology-lookup/browse.do?ontName=MI&termId=MI%3A0003&termName=feature%20detection%20method

items.description: Feature detection method (only for interaction evidences, not biological complexes) which is usually a term from the PSI-MI ontology: http://www.ebi.ac.uk/ontology-lookup/browse.do?ontName=MI&termId=MI%3A0003&termName=feature%20detection%20method

id.description: The feature detection method MI identifier from the PSI-MI ontology: http://www.ebi.ac.uk/ontology-lookup/browse.do?ontName=MI&termId=MI%3A0003&termName=feature%20detection%20method.

name.description: The feature detection method unique short name from the PSI-MI ontology: http://www.ebi.ac.uk/ontology-lookup/browse.do?ontName=MI&termId=MI%3A0003&termName=feature%20detection%20method.

parameters.description: List of experimental parameters for this feature. It does not make sense for biological complexes.

items.description: The experimental parameter determined fro this feature.

type.description: Parameter type which is usually a term from the PSI-MI ontology: http://www.ebi.ac.uk/ontology-lookup/browse.do?ontName=MI&termId=MI%3A0640&termName=parameter%20type

id.description: The parameter type MI identifier from the PSI-MI ontology: http://www.ebi.ac.uk/ontology-lookup/browse.do?ontName=MI&termId=MI%3A0640&termName=parameter%20type.

name.description: The parameter type unique short name from the PSI-MI ontology: http://www.ebi.ac.uk/ontology-lookup/browse.do?ontName=MI&termId=MI%3A0640&termName=parameter%20type.

unit.description: Parameter unit which is usually a term from the PSI-MI ontology: http://www.ebi.ac.uk/ontology-lookup/browse.do?ontName=MI&termId=MI%3A0647&termName=parameter%20unit

id.description: The parameter unit MI identifier from the PSI-MI ontology: http://www.ebi.ac.uk/ontology-lookup/browse.do?ontName=MI&termId=MI%3A0647&termName=parameter%20unit.

name.description: The parameter unit unique short name from the PSI-MI ontology: http://www.ebi.ac.uk/ontology-lookup/browse.do?ontName=MI&termId=MI%3A0647&termName=parameter%20unit.

linkedFeatures.description: List of feature ids this feature is linked to.

items.description: The feature id of the feature which is linked to the parent feature.

type.description: Feature type which is usually a term from the PSI-MI ontology: http://www.ebi.ac.uk/ontology-lookup/browse.do?ontName=MI&termId=MI%3A0505&termName=experimental%20feature

id.description: The feature type MI identifier from the PSI-MI ontology: http://www.ebi.ac.uk/ontology-lookup/browse.do?ontName=MI&termId=MI%3A0505&termName=experimental%20feature.

name.description: The feature type unique short name from the PSI-MI ontology: http://www.ebi.ac.uk/ontology-lookup/browse.do?ontName=MI&termId=MI%3A0505&termName=experimental%20feature.

role.description: Feature role which is usually a term from the PSI-MI ontology: http://www.ebi.ac.uk/ontology-lookup/browse.do?ontName=MI&termId=MI%3A0925&termName=observed%20ptm

id.description: The feature role MI identifier from the PSI-MI ontology: http://www.ebi.ac.uk/ontology-lookup/browse.do?ontName=MI&termId=MI%3A0925&termName=observed%20ptm.

name.description: The feature role unique short name from the PSI-MI ontology: http://www.ebi.ac.uk/ontology-lookup/browse.do?ontName=MI&termId=MI%3A0925&termName=observed%20ptm.

InterPro.description: The InterPro identifier which identifies this feature.

bioEffect.description: GO term associated with the molecular function of the interactor that is responsible for its regulatory activity.

id.description: GO term identifier associated with the molecular function of interactor that is responsible for its regulatory activity.

name.description: GO term short name associated with the molecular function of interactor that is responsible for its regulatory activity.

confidences.description: List of experimental confidences for this interaction. It does not make sense for biological complexes.

items.description: The experimental confidence determined fro this interaction.

type.description: Confidence type which is usually a term from the PSI-MI ontology: http://www.ebi.ac.uk/ontology-lookup/browse.do?ontName=MI&termId=MI%3A1064&termName=confidence

id.description: The confidence type MI identifier from the PSI-MI ontology: http://www.ebi.ac.uk/ontology-lookup/browse.do?ontName=MI&termId=MI%3A1064&termName=confidence.

name.description: The confidence type unique short name from the PSI-MI ontology: http://www.ebi.ac.uk/ontology-lookup/browse.do?ontName=MI&termId=MI%3A1064&termName=confidence.

value.description: Confidence value which is free text as it can be quantitative as qualitative.

parameters.description: List of experimental parameters for this interaction. It does not make sense for biological complexes.

items.description: The experimental parameter determined fro this interaction.

type.description: Parameter type which is usually a term from the PSI-MI ontology: http://www.ebi.ac.uk/ontology-lookup/browse.do?ontName=MI&termId=MI%3A0640&termName=parameter%20type

id.description: The parameter type MI identifier from the PSI-MI ontology: http://www.ebi.ac.uk/ontology-lookup/browse.do?ontName=MI&termId=MI%3A0640&termName=parameter%20type.

name.description: The parameter type unique short name from the PSI-MI ontology: http://www.ebi.ac.uk/ontology-lookup/browse.do?ontName=MI&termId=MI%3A0640&termName=parameter%20type.

unit.description: Parameter unit which is usually a term from the PSI-MI ontology: http://www.ebi.ac.uk/ontology-lookup/browse.do?ontName=MI&termId=MI%3A0647&termName=parameter%20unit

id.description: The parameter unit MI identifier from the PSI-MI ontology: http://www.ebi.ac.uk/ontology-lookup/browse.do?ontName=MI&termId=MI%3A0647&termName=parameter%20unit.

name.description: The parameter unit unique short name from the PSI-MI ontology: http://www.ebi.ac.uk/ontology-lookup/browse.do?ontName=MI&termId=MI%3A0647&termName=parameter%20unit.

common.description: The common name or short name of the organism.

scientific.description: The scientific name of full name of the organism.

taxid.description: The uniprot taxonomy identifier for this organism. Can be -1 if in vitro, -2 if chemical synthesis, -3 if unknown, -4 if in vivo

cellType.description: The cell type of the organism. This is only provided when the interaction is not a biological complex

id.description: The cell type ontology identifier if one exists.

name.description: The cell type short name.

tissue.description: The source tissue of the organism. This is only provided when the interaction is not a biological complex

id.description: The source tissue ontology identifier if one exists.

name.description: The source tissue short name.

compartment.description: The subcellular compartment of the organism. This is only provided when the interaction is not a biological complex

id.description: The subcellular compartment ontology identifier if one exists.

name.description: The subcellular compartment type short name.

evidenceType.description: The interaction evidence type which is usually term from ECO ontology: http://www.ebi.ac.uk/ontology-lookup/browse.do?ontName=ECO.

id.description: The evidence type identifier from the ECO ontology: http://www.ebi.ac.uk/ontology-lookup/browse.do?ontName=ECO.

name.description: The evidence type short name from the ECO ontology: http://www.ebi.ac.uk/ontology-lookup/browse.do?ontName=ECO.

complexType.description: The complex type (only if the interaction is a biological complex) which is usually term from PSI-MI ontology: http://www.ebi.ac.uk/ontology-lookup/browse.do?ontName=MI&termId=MI%3A1298&termName=complex%20type.

id.description: The complex type MI identifier from the PSI-MI ontology: http://www.ebi.ac.uk/ontology-lookup/browse.do?ontName=MI&termId=MI%3A1298&termName=complex%20type.

name.description: The complex type unique short name from the PSI-MI ontology: http://www.ebi.ac.uk/ontology-lookup/browse.do?ontName=MI&termId=MI%3A1298&termName=complex%20type.

expansion.description: The complex expansion method use to explode a n-ary interaction in n-1 binary interactions. It does not make sense for biological complexes. It is usually a term of the PSI-MI ontology: http://www.ebi.ac.uk/ontology-lookup/browse.do?ontName=MI&termId=MI%3A1059&termName=complex%20expansion

id.description: The complex expansion id which is unique per expanded n-ary interactions. It helps to detect all binary pairs that were part of the same n-ary interaction.

name.description: The complex expansion method short name from the PSI-MI ontology: http://www.ebi.ac.uk/ontology-lookup/browse.do?ontName=MI&termId=MI%3A1059&termName=complex%20expansion.

causalRelationship.description: The causal relationship between a participant source and a participant target.

participantRef.description: The id of the interactor instance/participant that is the source of the causal statement.The participantRef needs to be consistent with the biological role of the participant (e.g. regulator) that is refering.

interactorRef.description: The id of the interactor/molecule that is the source of the causal statement.

participantRef.description: The id of the interactor instance/participant that is the target of the causal statement.The participantRef needs to be consistent with the biological role of the participant (e.g. regulator target) that is refereing.

interactorRef.description: The id of the interactor/molecule that is the target of the causal statement.

causalStatement.description: The causality statement between the participant source and the participant target which is usually from the PSI-MI ontology: http://www.ebi.ac.uk/ontology-lookup/browse.do?ontName=MI&termId=MI%3A2234&termName=causal%20statement.

id.description: The causality statement MI identifier from the PSI-MI ontology: http://www.ebi.ac.uk/ontology-lookup/browse.do?ontName=MI&termId=MI%3A2234&termName=causal%20statement.

name.description: The causality statement unique short name from the PSI-MI ontology: http://www.ebi.ac.uk/ontology-lookup/browse.do?ontName=MI&termId=MI%3A2234&termName=causal%20statement.

causalRegulatoryMechanism.description: The causal regulatory mechanism for the causal interaction which is usually from the PSI-MI ontology: http://www.ebi.ac.uk/ontology-lookup/browse.do?ontName=MI&termId=MI%3A2245&termName=causal%20regulatory%20mechanism

id.description: The causal regulatory mechanism MI identifier from the PSI-MI ontology: http://www.ebi.ac.uk/ontology-lookup/browse.do?ontName=MI&termId=MI%3A2245&termName=causal%20regulatory%20mechanism.

name.description: The causal regulatory mechanism unique short name from the PSI-MI ontology: http://www.ebi.ac.uk/ontology-lookup/browse.do?ontName=MI&termId=MI%3A2245&termName=causal%20regulatory%20mechanism.

data.description: Data array containing all interactions, interactors and complexes
